lines.content: This allows the program to have the ability to store text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
The program breaks down the adding of tasks using 3 different keywords.
Add support for deleting tasks from the list.
Allows the program to display the lists of task currently in the program when requested.
Allows the program to mark certain tasks in the list as done.
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.
### `deadline` - Adding a task to remind the user of a deadline to meet.
`Now you have 6 tasks in the list.`
### `todo` - Adding a task to remind the user of a tasks that needs to be done.
`Now you have 5 tasks in the list`
### `event` - Adding a task to remind the user of an event scheduled.
`Now you have 7 tasks in the list.`
### `delete` - Deletes the task specified from the current tasks list.
`Now you have 4 tasks in the list.`
### `list` - To display the tasks list currently in the program.
`Here are the tasks in your list:`\
### `done` - Allow the task indicated to be marked as done.
`Nice! I've marked this task as done:`\
### `find` - To search through the current tasks list to find any task matching a keyword.
`Here are the matching tasks in your list:`\
@ This Duke class is where the main program runs.
@ The duke method initialise the UI and storage.
@ storage.loadflile loads the data saved in the file and writes it into an array list to be passed into the program
@An error exception is written so that if there is no file present, the program will create a new file and initialise an array list
@ the run method runs the UI.welcome to print responses from the program to interact with the user
@ It reads in the user input and passes the command into the program to be processed.
@Duke Exception is a class that extends the Exception library of Java and acts as a parent class
@ for the various other exceptions to be handled.
return "OOPS! No such task exists, please try again.";
return "OOPS!!! Please follow the Deadline format! ";
return "OOPS!!! Please follow the Event format! ";
return "OOPS!!! Please follow the Todo format! ";
@ The parses class deals with the user inputs to determine which command will be called into the program
@ depending on the user input, the string will determine what command is contain in the User input and calls upon
@ the various methods as show below.
@ the various exceptions are thrown below as well to catch any error that might occur during the program.
public static String parse(String inputs, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! That task number does not exist");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! That input is in the wrong format!");
@ Storage class is written to write and save data into a file. More prominent methods like createfile, loadfile and writetofile
@ loadfile reads the first letter of the saved data in the txt.file which passes the string into various methods to be processed like
@ loadEvent, loadDeadline and loadTodo. These methods splits the strings to a format to be added into the arraylist = loadedTasks
@ After processing, loadedTask is pass back into Duke which would be the arraylist to be used throughout the program.
@ writeToFile clears the file whenever it is called and rewrites the data that is currently in the arraylist.
public void writeToFile(ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws IOException {
@The task class is an abstract class that holds the method to be used for the various task, Deadline, Todo, Event;
@ As such, abstract methods can be used as well like saveTask to obtain the format of the string to be saved or getDescription to
@ get the description of the task
@ This class is responsible for dealing with the various commands that changes the tasklists.
@ it holds commands like add, delete, find etc.
@ the addTask method is further broken down into addDeadline, addEvent, addTodo,
@ these various methods breaks down the user input so that it fits the format to be added into the
@ array list in addTask. addTask also calls the method storage.writeTofile which clears the file and rewrite
@ with the current content of the file.
@ Similarly for deleteTask, the task to be deleted is removed from the arrayList and a storage.writetofile is called
@ to rewrite the content of the file to match the current arrayList
@ findTask is a method that iterates through the current arraylist and adds any task that contains the keyword into
@ another arraylist which is passed to the UI to print.
